import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory

    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

import geopandas as gpd
ghmc = gpd.read_file("/kaggle/input/ghmc-data/GHMC.geojson")
ghmc.head()
source.4b575471:
ghmc.name = ghmc.name.str.lstrip("Ward")
ghmc["Ward_Number"] = ghmc.name.str.extract(r'(?P<Ward_No>\d+)')
ghmc["Ward_Name"] = ghmc.name.str.split(' ').str[2:].str.join(" ")
ghmc.head()

ghmc_amenities.dropna(subset = ['Ward_Number'], inplace=True)
ghmc_amenities.head()

import folium
from folium import Choropleth, Circle, Marker
from folium.plugins import HeatMap, MarkerCluster
source.4b0d9a77:
ID_Mappings = {'TOILETS':('lightgray','university'), 'COMMUNITY HALLS':('lightgray','church'), 'OPEN SPACES':('lightgray','chair'), 'PARKS':('lightgray','futbol'),
       'PLAY GROUNDS':('lightgray','futbol'), 'DUMPER BINS':('lightgray','shopping-basket'), 'HOSPITALS':('lightgray','clinic-medical'), 'ANGANWADI CENTERS':('lightgray','hands-helping'),
       'NIGHT SHELTERS':('lightgray','bed'), 'ANNAPURNA MEALS':('lightgray','apple-alt'), 'FIRE STATIONS':('lightgray','fire-extinguisher'),
       'HERITAGE BUILDINGS':('lightgray','monument'), '2BHK':('lightgray','building'), 'MARKET COMPLEXES':('lightgray','shopping-cart')}
source.125fa5c5:
# Create a map
m_1 = folium.Map(location=[17.400789,78.400245], tiles='cartodbpositron', zoom_start=11.25)

# Display the map
# Add points to the map
count = 0
for idx, row in GHMC.iterrows():
    Marker([row['Latitude'], row['Longitude']],icon=folium.Icon(color=ID_Mappings[row['Category']][0], 
                                                                icon=ID_Mappings[row['Category']][1], 
                                                                prefix='fa',
                                                               ),
          tooltip=row['Category']
          ).add_to(m_1)
    count+=1
    if count == 10:
        break
choropleth = Choropleth(geo_data=ghmc ,columns=['Ward_Name']
          ).add_to(m_1)
choropleth.geojson.add_child(
    folium.features.GeoJsonTooltip(['Ward_Name'],labels=False)
)
m_1
source.7a6529c6:
finding_ward_name = []
real_ward_name, real_ward_number = [],[]
for point in ghmc_amenities.geometry.values:
    count = 0
    for idx, row in ghmc.iterrows():
        if point.within(row.geometry):
            finding_ward_name.append(row.geometry)
            real_ward_number.append(row.Ward_Number)
            real_ward_name.append(row.Ward_Name)
            count = 0
            break
        count+=1
    if count == len(ghmc.geometry.values):
        finding_ward_name.append(np.nan)
source.71e03bf0:
Ward_Wise_Amenities = ghmc_amenities.groupby(["Ward_Name","Category"])["Sno"].count().reset_index()
Ward_Wise_Amenities.columns = ["Ward_Name","Amenties","Count"]
def fetch_ward_number(value):
    ward_name_to_number = dict(zip(ghmc["Ward_Name"],ghmc["Ward_Number"]))
    return ward_name_to_number[value]
Ward_Wise_Amenities["Ward_Number"] = Ward_Wise_Amenities.Ward_Name.apply(fetch_ward_number)

Ward_Wise_Amenities.head()

ward_name_to_number.keys() - Wards_having_hospitals.Ward_Name.values
source.6ea8d788:
m = folium.Map([17.400789,78.400245], zoom_start=11.25,tiles='openstreetmap')


# heat_data = [[row['Latitude'],row['Longitude']] for index, row in ghmc_amenities[ghmc_amenities.Category == "HOSPITALS"][["Latitude","Longitude"]].iterrows()]
# HeatMap(heat_data).add_to(m)

choropleth = folium.Choropleth(
    geo_data=ghmc,
    name='choropleth',
    data=Ward_Wise_Amenities[Ward_Wise_Amenities.Amenties == "HOSPITALS"],
    columns=['Ward_Name', 'Count'],
    key_on='feature.properties.Ward_Name',
    fill_color='BuPu',
    fill_opacity=0.7,
    line_opacity=0.4,
    popup="Count",
    legend_name='No.of Hospitals(in numbers)',
    highlight=True,
    line_color='black',
).add_to(m)

marker_cluster = MarkerCluster().add_to(m)

for idx, row in ghmc_amenities[ghmc_amenities.Category == "HOSPITALS"][["Latitude","Longitude","Category","Assessor Address"]].iterrows():
    popup = row["Category"]+"\n"+row["Assessor Address"]
    folium.Marker(location=[row['Latitude'], row['Longitude']],
                                radius=0.25,
                                tooltip=popup,
                                color=ID_Mappings[row.Category][0],
                                fill_color='red',
                                icon=folium.Icon(color=ID_Mappings[row['Category']][0], 
                                                                icon=ID_Mappings[row['Category']][1], 
                                                                prefix='fa',
                                                               ),
                                fill=True).add_to(marker_cluster)

choropleth.geojson.add_child(
    folium.features.GeoJsonTooltip(['Ward_Name'],labels=False)
)

folium.TileLayer('Stamen Terrain').add_to(m)
folium.TileLayer('Stamen Toner').add_to(m)
folium.TileLayer('Stamen Water Color').add_to(m)
folium.TileLayer('cartodbpositron').add_to(m)
folium.TileLayer('cartodbdark_matter').add_to(m)
folium.LayerControl().add_to(m)

m

for key,value in Missing_Amenities.items():
    for item in value:
        Wards_without_Amenities = Wards_without_Amenities.append({"Ward_Name" : key, "Amenities":item}, ignore_index = True)
no_of_Amenities_missed = Wards_without_Amenities.groupby(["Ward_Name"]).count().reset_index()

source.d060baf3:
# **Why am I doing this Analysis?**

Data Analysis, Data Science is currently being used in almost all fields, but most of them are business goal oriented. Usually, an Organization opts for Data Analysis for analyzing the Client Related Goals which in turn makes money in the process. 

But we rarely see an Analysis on Development of society/public. It's just a thought of analyzing the Local Governance for the betterment of Public which in turn leads to Development at Nation Level.

It would be really helpful for the society, if the Data science Community can think of social development.

# **What am I doing in this kernel?**

1. Finding out the Amenities(ward wise)
2. Comparing the Wards based on Amenities
3. Listing out the Wards that contain basic Amenities(Such as Hospitals, Toilets, etc)
4. Listing out the Wards that doesn't contain basic Amenities(Such as Hospitals, Toilets, etc)
5. Finding out the Top and bottom 5 Wards based on existing Amenities.


# **How will this be useful?**

Corporaters can raise a question about the Amenities that aren't present in their wards. Apart from that, Public can question the Corporators during election campaigning about the Amenities that aren't present in their Wards but are present in neighborhood Wards. In this way, this kernal can be helpful to public for the betterment of their own ward.

source.c646ebdf:
Understanding few Amenities
1. **Annapurna Meals: Addressing the Urban Hunger**

GHMC provides hygienic and safe Food to under privileged, poor and down trodden, at just Rs.5/- per meal. The scheme had started with 8 centres in 2014 and has now expanded to 150 centre’s serving 25,000 people with hot and nourishing meals daily through Hare Krishna Movement Charitable Foundation. There are plans to extend the number of centres to meet the burgeoning demand for these centres owing to its huge popularity among the poor. In this scheme Rs. 5/- is paid by the beneficiary and GHMC subsidizes remaining amount to Hare Krishna Movement Charitable Foundation. (Info from https://csr.ghmc.gov.in/feedingthepoor.aspx )
![Annapurna Canteen](https://csr.ghmc.gov.in/images/InnerImages/Annapurna.jpg)


2. **NIGHT SHELTERS**

The aim is to see that no one has to fight the cold out on the streets. They can go to our shelters and stay there. We will have mattresses, blankets and drinking water in all our shelters. Currently, there are 15 night shelters in the city and GHMC operates these facilities in association with different NGOs and voluntary organisations. This apart, the municipal corporation distributes blankets for the poor and homeless in many areas to help them stay warm.Ref(https://telanganatoday.com/ghmc-to-set-up-more-night-shelters-to-keep-homeless-warm)

3. **ANGANWADI CENTERS**

Anganwadi is a type of rural child care centre in India. They were started by the Indian government in 1975 as part of the Integrated Child Development Services program to combat child hunger and malnutrition. Anganwadi means "courtyard shelter" in Hindi.


4.**2BHK**

The Telangana government introduced the Dignity Housing Scheme, popularly called the 2BHK Housing Scheme or the double room scheme in October 2015, to ensure that those in need of a roof over their head while being unable to afford it, can be eligible for a property under this scheme. While the centre and various state governments also offer subsidised housing for the economically weaker sections, the Telangana government went a step further, to make these units, priced anywhere between Rs 5 lakhs to Rs 8.65 lakhs, totally free of cost for the beneficiaries. The housing department has taken up the construction of 2.80 lakh units.
![2BHK](http://haigreeva.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Ameenpur-1.jpeg) (Ref: haigreeva.com)
source.04c96e5b:
# **INTRODUCTION** 
In this kernel, I am working on GHMC Data. GHMC is a civic body in Telangana, INDIA.
GHMC stands for Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation.
The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is the civic body that oversees Hyderabad, the capital and largest city of the Indian state of Telangana. It is the local government for the cities of Hyderabad and Secunderabad. It is one of the largest municipal corporations in India with a population of 6.9 million and an area of 625 km².(From wiki)

![GHMC ZONES](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e2/GHMC_NEW_ZONES%2CCIRCLE_MAP.jpg)
